channel.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

image.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition

item.title: US on track to hit 1 million new cases in 2 weeks as daily death toll tops 1,000
Brazil's president again tests positive for coronavirus
US abruptly orders China to close its consulate in Houston
Pompeo is asked why US closed China Houston consulate. Hear his reply
item.description: US Secretary of State Mike Pompeo addressed the United States' closure of the Chinese consulate in Houston, Texas, saying the US would "take actions that protect the American people, protect our security, our national security."

item.title: Trump's ambassador to the UK is accused of making racist and sexist remarks to staff
item.description: The billionaire NFL owner who serves as President Donald Trump's ambassador to the United Kingdom was investigated by the State Department watchdog after allegations that he made racist and sexist comments to staff and sought to use his government position to benefit the President's personal business in the UK, multiple sources told CNN.

item.title: Kim Kardashian West addresses Kanye's mental health after his Twitter meltdown
item.description: Kim Kardashian West has shared a message about her husband Kanye West and mental health.

item.title: The EU struck a big rescue deal on Covid-19. But it might have dealt a blow to democracy
item.description: Brussels began the week in celebratory mood, as member states of the European Union finally agreed how they would distribute around $2 trillion of funds across the bloc over the next seven years.

item.title: Mother stranded in Dubai with newborn quadruplets due to travel restrictions
Obama and Biden release video criticizing Trump's pandemic response
item.description: Former President Barack Obama and presumptive Democratic presidential nominee Joe Biden criticize President Donald Trump's handling of the coronavirus pandemic in a new campaign video.

item.title: Trump set to expand federal policing operation to more cities despite pushback
item.description: President Donald Trump is set to expand a federal law enforcement operation to two American cities on Wednesday, a person familiar with the plans said, even as local leaders voice resistance to the move.

item.title: US and UK changing diplomatic immunity rules after envoy killed 19-year-old in car crash
item.description: The UK government says it has reached a deal with the United States to change the diplomatic immunity rules that meant an American woman charged with causing the death of a British teenager in a road accident has not had to return to face trial.

item.title: Rand Paul joins pile-on of GOP congresswoman for splitting with Trump
item.description: Sen. Rand Paul, a long-time critic of Rep. Liz Cheney, joined the conservative pile-on of the Wyoming Republican, saying on Wednesday: "I don't think she's good for the country" and accused her of trying to "sabotage" President Donald Trump's foreign policy.

item.title: Hostage siege ends after Ukraine President agrees to endorse 2005 Joaquin Phoenix film
item.description: An hours-long hostage siege ended in the Ukrainian city of Lutsk on Tuesday night after President Volodymyr Zelensky met one of the alleged gunman's unusual demands -- to endorse a 2005 documentary about humanity's abuse of animals.

item.title: 'El Chapo' waits for his ticket out of jail
item.description: Just one year ago, Joaquin "El Chapo" Guzman, the former most powerful and dangerous kingpin in the world, was sentenced to life in prison, plus 30 years.

item.title: Teenage girl and younger brother kill Taliban militants who murdered their parents
item.description: A teenage girl and her younger brother killed two Taliban militants who murdered their parents in Ghor province, Afghanistan.

item.title: Republican who reportedly called Ocasio-Cortez 'f*****g b****' gives non-apology master class
item.description: On Wednesday morning, Florida Republican Rep. Ted Yoho took to the House floor to deliver an "apology."

item.title: CNN anchor fires back at Trump campaign official: You're lying
item.description: CNN's Brianna Keilar talks to Trump campaign communications director Tim Murtaugh about coronavirus testing.

item.title: 80 years later, China won't forget what these American pilots did
item.description: Consider this job offer:

item.title: Humans may have arrived in North America much earlier than believed, new research says
item.description: Scientists have discovered evidence that may push back the timeline for humans living in North America from 13,000 years ago to 30,000 years ago, according to two new studies.

item.title: Twenty-three abducted children, aged 3 months to 15 years, rescued from house
item.description: Twenty-three children have been rescued after being abducted and forced to sell handicrafts in a tourist town in southern Mexico.

item.title: Video shows Trump in public just hours after mask tweet
item.description: President Trump tweeted a rare photo of himself in a face mask after struggling in the polls, but just hours later he was seen in public without one.

item.title: How Fox News has changed in the four years since Roger Ailes was ousted
item.description: Roger Ailes was forced to walk the Fox News plank four years ago this week.

item.title: Tropical storm sets record as it churns toward Caribbean
item.description: Tropical Depression Seven strengthened into Tropical Storm Gonzalo on Wednesday, according to the National Hurricane Center (NHC).

item.title: Venice restricts numbers allowed on gondolas, complaining that tourists have gotten fatter
item.description: The coronavirus pandemic has placed a heavy burden on Venice's vast tourism industry. But as it emerges from lockdown, the city is attempting to ease another load from the shoulders of its gondoliers.

item.title: 'Chair Girl' avoids jail for hurling chair onto Toronto freeway from high-rise building
item.description: A 20-year-old woman nicknamed "Chair Girl," who was filmed hurling a chair onto a freeway from the balcony of a high-rise building in downtown Toronto, has avoided jail time.

item.title: 11 billion years of history in one map: Astrophysicists reveal largest 3D model of the universe ever created
item.description: A global consortium of astrophysicists have created the world's largest three-dimensional map of the universe, a project 20 years in the making that researchers say helps better explain the history of the cosmos.

item.title: Rolling Stones debut long-lost track featuring Jimmy Page
item.description: The Rolling Stones have unveiled "Scarlet," a previously unheard track featuring Led Zeppelin guitarist Jimmy Page and Blind Faith's Rick Gerch.

item.title: Promising vaccine gets the 'real test' in African country
item.description: The initial results for the Oxford vaccine have been promising, but researcher say the real test for the experimental vaccine will come in South Africa. CNN's David McKenzie goes inside the Johannesburg arm of the study, where scientists are trying to enroll 2,000 participants in the middle of the Covid-19 pandemic.

item.title: CNN's Alisyn Camerota on lawsuit: I guess Fox News is rotten to the core
item.description: CNN's Alisyn Camerota reacts to a lawsuit filed in federal court against Fox News which accused former host Ed Henry of rape and alleged that he retaliated against two women who rejected his advances.

item.title: This organization is creating access to virtual classrooms for children in slums
item.description: Seated outside her home in Makoko, a low-income community in Lagos, Nigeria's bustling megacity, Margaret Okpoe is tapping away on her new tablet.

item.title: Meet the flying robot that can glide, flip and hover
item.description: Engineers have designed a robot with flapping wings, which can perform nimble movements in the air, hovering, darting, diving and recovering like a bird or an insect.

item.title: Scientists accidentally create new hybrid fish
item.description: Researchers in Hungary were trying to save the Russian sturgeon from extinction. Instead, they accidentally created the hybrid "sturddlefish."

item.title: Airlines appeal for coronavirus testing to restore transatlantic flights
Dark chocolate's benefits: A heart-healthy option in moderation
item.description: Open wide. Insert dark chocolate. Chew slowly, savor and lick any bits off fingers. Smile broadly as you bask in the relief that this guilty pleasure is actually helping your heart.

item.title: Valentino's couture collection was an 'extreme response' to the pandemic
item.description: Valentino's Fall 2020 haute couture collection has set the bar high for what can be achieved with a runway show while lockdown measures are still in place.

item.title: Designs for underwater 'space station' unveiled
item.description: Sixty feet beneath the surface of the Caribbean Sea, aquanaut Fabien Cousteau and industrial designer Yves Béhar are envisioning the world's largest underwater research station and habitat.

item.title: Cheez-It releases limited-edition box with wine pairing
item.description: Kellogg's Cheez-It and House Wine have teamed up to create a wine-and-Cheez-It box. HLN's Robin Meade and Melissa Knowles discuss.

item.title: Goalkeeper, 16, makes remarkable recovery after being struck by lightning
item.description: Russian goalkeeper Ivan Zaborovsky, 16, has made a remarkable recovery after he was struck by lightning during a training session earlier this month.

item.title: Vivienne Westwood suspends herself in giant birdcage to protest Assange's extradition
item.description: Fashion designer Vivienne Westwood has made a high-profile plea to halt Julian Assange's possible extradition to the US by suspending herself in a giant birdcage outside Britain's central criminal court Tuesday.

item.title: David Schwimmer says 'Friends' reunion is happening soon
item.description: David Schwimmer talked about the impending "Friends" reunion special on "The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon."

item.title: First image of 2 exoplanets orbiting a sun-like star captured by scientists
item.description: About 300 light-years away from us, two giant exoplanets are orbiting a young sun-like star.

item.title: Sick of working from home? Work at a hotel instead
US is heading in the wrong direction with Covid-19 numbers, and it's doing so with astonishing speed
item.description: • ANALYSIS: Don't be fooled: There is no 'new' Trump on coronavirus • OPINION: Trump could learn from Europe's leaders, who've begun charting a recovery from Covid-19 • Nicaragua's Ortega says Covid-19 is under control, unlike in 'capitalist' countries

item.title: Don't be fooled: There is no 'new' Trump on coronavirus
item.description: On Tuesday night, President Donald Trump, in his first coronavirus briefing in several months, delivered a sober assessment of the fight against Covid-19 -- acknowledging that "it will probably unfortunately get worse before it gets better" and even offering a sort-of endorsement for mask-wearing. At just over 30 minutes, the briefing was far shorter than the rollicking (and rambling) updates Trump was providing on the virus earlier in the year. And Trump himself was significantly more disciplined, largely sticking to prepared remarks and avoiding long asides in which he cast blame on everyone but himself for the current coronavirus state of affairs.

item.title: GOP balks at Trump call to withhold money from closed schools
item.description: Republicans in the Senate are roundly dismissing President Donald Trump's call to withhold more federal aid from schools that remain shuttered during the coronavirus pandemic, the latest sign of a split between the White House and the GOP over their party's response to the public health emergency.

item.title: There's a big lesson for Trump in Europe
item.description: It was the first time Europe's leaders had seen each other face-to-face since the pandemic swept across the continent, shredding the European Union and causing untold pain and economic suffering, followed in most quarters by a recovery unlike anything experienced in the United States. With 27 different agendas, it was a model of how to deal with a critical issue of money.

item.title: Brazil's president again tests positive for Covid-19
US abruptly orders China to close its consulate in Houston
item.description: • Pompeo responds to closure of China's Houston consulate

item.title: Country of 12.5M has only 5 Covid deaths
item.description: Densely-populated Rwanda is emerging as one nation that has effectively managed coronavirus. But its success dealing with the pandemic began long before the virus emerged. CNN's Stephanie Busari reports.
